tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE languages (
  language_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  language_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  last_update TIMESTAMP
)
CREATE TABLE language (language_id INT PRIMARY KEY, language_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE country (country_id INT PRIMARY KEY, country_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE user_profile (user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, user_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, country_id INT REFERENCES country(country_id));
CREATE TABLE user_language (user_id INT REFERENCES user_profile(user_id), language_id INT REFERENCES language(language_id), proficiency_level VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    preferred_language_id UUID,
    FOREIGN KEY (preferred_language_id) REFERENCES languages(language_id)
);

CREATE TABLE products (
    product_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    language_id UUID,
    FOREIGN KEY (language_id) REFERENCES languages(language_id)
);

CREATE TABLE translations (
    translation_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    source_language_id UUID,
    target_language_id UUID,
    source_text TEXT,
    target_text TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (source_language_id) REFERENCES languages(language_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (target_language_id) REFERENCES languages(language_id)
);

CREATE TABLE orders (
    order_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id UUID,
    product_id UUID,
    quantity INT NOT NULL,
    order_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES products(product_id)
);
